York men run ragged by speedy Leeds in defeat

York's miserable league form continued as they were completely outpaced by a strong Leeds outfit losing 5-2 in the hockey

BUCS Cup progress for York in hard-fought victory

York firsts squeezed past their counterparts from Teesside in this BUCS Cup encounter, winning this most important of matches 33-29 to set up a quarter-final date with Durham seconds next Wednesday.

Women into rugby quarter-finals

York women's rugby team successfully married BUCS Cup progression to their imperious league form yesterday afternoon, with a 34-0 triumph against Leeds Trinity which was, in all honesty, every bit as easy as it appears.

Rugby seconds beat Newcastle for first league win

York seconds recorded their first league victory of the season as they beat Newcastle fourths with a flattering 38-0 scoreline.

York set sights on BUCS rugby title after Teesside

York University 44 Teesside University 0 York's rugby firsts started the year in the best possible way by extending their winning BUCS League sequence to four matches with a 44-0 victory over Teesside on Wednesday.

Ambitious Lacy to lobby for a Sports Department at UGM

York Sport president Alex Lacy will propose two radical motions at the up-coming UGM in an attempt to revolutionise campus sport.

New Manager Foyle aims to rebuild City

Martin Foyle has pledged to reconstruct York City from the foundations up, knitting together every aspect of the club behind his ambition to return as soon as possible to the Football League. In an exclusive and revealing interview with Nouse, the former Port Vale boss laid out his vision for the struggling Conference outfit and expressed his dismay at the wider state of football in the twenty-first century.

Bright future for volleyballers punching above their weight in the big leagues

Not many of York's sports teams have enjoyed the same amount of success in recent years as the men's volleyball team.

Futsal firsts on verge of Nationals

The University of York Futsal first team is close to qualifying for the BUCS Championships for the first time in the club's ten year history after two wins out of two in the initial group matches late last term. York are currently in an excellent position to be one of three teams to represent the Northern Region at the tournament held in Sheffield in March.

College Notebook: Egg Chasers

Rugby is back. A thrilling tri-college tournament, organised despite all manner of difficulties, has heralded its first class return. Nouse sees what all the fuss is about...

Michael Leahy

Well it's 2009, and I'm sure many resolutions have been made (and broken). Exams are now out of the way, and sport at York is starting to get back into full swing.

The Mixer

Wednesday afternoon. Sport o'clock. As The Mixer surveys the lush green loveliness of the 22 Acres under the crisp spring sunshine, hoards of York's finest, bedecked in amber and black, prowl for BUCS points. So, where the f**k is everyone?

Brodie at the double in welcome York win

The new York City manager has pledged to rebuild this decaying club from the foundations upwards and, while a 3-0 win over relegation candidates Lewes must be placed in context, there were plenty of reasons to be cheerful following this performance...

Weather can't stop Derwent in tri-college rugby

A second-half revival from plucky Derwent, battling not only a strong Alcuin opposition but inhospitable weather conditions, means the outcome of this keenly-contested college rugby tournament now rests on a Christmas cliff-hanger...

Adam Shergold's Wednesday round-up: 10 December

The term's final round of BUCS matches were played on Wednesday. Sports Editor Adam Shergold reviews the day's action in association with YSTV and the York Sport show...

Tough week for volleyballers compounded by Hallam

Captain's Comments: Men's volleyball maestro Jack Butcher takes a closer look at his team's performance against a very tough Sheffield Hallam side on Wednesday...

Seconds outclassed by Leeds in cup netball

York seconds were denied a place in round four of the BUCS Cup yesterday afternoon after a disappointing home loss against their Leeds University counterparts...

Women's volleyball whitewash Sheffield Hallam

York women's volleyball team ended the year on a high by thrashing Sheffield Hallam in straight sets, taking victory by a 25-7, 25-20 and 25-20 scoreline...

Panto season comes to 22 Acres

A mixture of nauseous refereeing and sulky opposition turned this BUCS Cup fixture into a farce, a late Joe Brennan goal the only high point in what was a lacklustre York display...

Crowd support can't inspire volleyball team to win

York suffered a heavy defeat against Leeds Met on Sunday, an unfortunately-timed loss after an outstanding win against Manchester last week...

More success for York's rowers at Newark race

The University Boat Club capped a successful term with another glut of medals on a tough course at the Newark Head of the River Race on Sunday...

More questions than answers for new York City regime

A shambolic 1-0 reverse at home to Grays Athletic, a team drowning in the Conference basement battle, wasn't the start the new York City manager would have wanted in his first game today...

College Notebook: Football Fiascos

Nouse's college commentator John Halstead takes a sideways glance at the world of college football with James and Alcuin heading a tight table...

Alex Lacy

One of the most visible accomplishments of the York Sport Committee this term has been in helping the first class coverage of the sports matches each Wednesday.

Adam Shergold's Wednesday round-up: 3 December

Sports Editor Adam Shergold reviews Wednesday's BUCS action and all the home highlights are brought to you in association with YSTV and the York Sport Show...

Women's badminton ease past under-strength Huddersfield

York women's badminton will have few easier fixtures this season than yesterday's match, where Huddersfield were forced to forfeit two of their doubles rubbers before even entering the court...

Battling ballers defeated by strong Leeds Met side

A valiant effort by the York University basketball first team wasn't enough as they eventually lost out to their Leeds Met counterparts yesterday...

Straight sets victory perfect riposte for volleyball team

York gained a satisfying victory over adversaries Manchester yesterday to vanquishing the memory of a straight sets defeat earlier this season...

Unlikely comeback for water polo team in Upolo League

York's water polo team could finally immerse themselves in competitive action on Wednesday but it took an impressive fightback to secure the win...

Hard fought draw with Hallam for Badminton seconds

The ever-confident James Hor saw off both his singles opponents to make up for Captain Tom Gatenby's unlucky performances, earning York seconds a 4-4 draw with Sheffield Hallam seconds...
